clinical_summary: On 2025-03-06 laboratory testing demonstrated markedly elevated conjugated bilirubin (7.79 mg/dL) with a concurrent rise in unconjugated bilirubin (1.63 mg/dL) while total bilirubin remained within normal limits; hepatic enzymes were increased (AST 162 U/L, ALT 86 U/L); cholestatic markers were markedly elevated (alkaline phosphatase 396 U/L, gamma‑GT 263 U/L); albumin was low (3.7 g/dL) with total protein 6.2 g/dL and an albumin/globulin ratio of 1.48.

differential_diagnoses.name: Obstructive cholestasis (e.g., biliary obstruction, gallstone, stricture)
differential_diagnoses.justification: High conjugated bilirubin, markedly elevated alkaline phosphatase and gamma‑GT support a cholestatic pattern.

differential_diagnoses.name: Hepatocellular injury (e.g., viral hepatitis, drug‑induced liver injury)
differential_diagnoses.justification: Elevated AST and ALT indicate hepatocellular damage alongside cholestatic abnormalities.

differential_diagnoses.name: Mixed hyperbilirubinemia (combined hemolysis and cholestasis)
differential_diagnoses.justification: Presence of both elevated unconjugated (1.63 mg/dL) and conjugated bilirubin suggests concurrent hemolytic and cholestatic processes.
